comments:
-- Error Log --
Date: Mon Jul 31 12:56:56 EDT 2006
Message: Did not externalize: jira
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core
Stack Trace:
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:787)
at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:823)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.JiraTaskExternalizer.createQueryElement(JiraTaskExternalizer.java:153)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.util.TaskListWriter.writeTaskList(TaskListWriter.java:109)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.TaskListManager.saveTaskList(TaskListManager.java:567)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.util.TaskListSaveManager.saveTaskList(TaskListSaveManager.java:72)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.util.TaskListSaveManager.containerInfoChanged(TaskListSaveManager.java:213)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.core.TaskList.notifyContainerUpdated(TaskList.java:544)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.SynchronizeQueryJob.run(SynchronizeQueryJob.java:101)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I assume that there was no bad behavior as a result of this, since the externalization should have happened on the next attempt.  But we do need to get rid of this concurrency.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 154895 ***
